Articles.Content: Tw1 Im totally with you on the game needing female characters, but my guess is it isn't just a matter of modeling a few, they're probably planning a big pass on unique trainable kerbals and all that entails, and are simply waiting till then to do the modeling.
Let's not get into the female kerbals thing again, please.

This got derailed IN A RECORD 2 POSTS..... Amazzing isn't it...

But...

What do the other tiers look like, apparently we have 3-5 per building...

Also what do we start with... Will we have construct the low tier buildings from scratch except for the VAB and tracking station ?

Speculation.... Anybody ???
A variable length runway might be interesting. The more it's upgraded, the longer your takeoffs and landings can be, and longer runways are bigger targets for 100% recovery.

A variable length runway might be interesting. The more it's upgraded, the longer your takeoffs and landings can be, and longer runways are bigger targets for 100% recovery.

That's not a bad idea! A variable size launchpad could be cool too (the first tier launchpad could be something like 5-10 meters across).

I know you can launch rockets bigger than the launchpad if you use clamps. But maybe the clamps could be incompatible with the lower tier pads because they are too weak to support them.

Edited November 9, 2014 by Rthsom

I actually quite like the idea of starting at a barn/junkyard since Jeb's Junkyard Co. and stuff. I agree that they could improve the looks of the buildings a lot. They should definitely take a second look at the textures and models before saying this is done. I hope this is just an early version of tier 1.

Just looking at the graphics in current 0.25, the runway is made up of several individual sections. Seeing a runway that had a section wrecked in the middle just confirms that indeed variable length is probable. Now launchpad size would go along with weight capacity of the crawlerway.

At first glance I saw a bunch of monoliths, but, maybe they are pylons. The dash of boulders mixed with the concrete sacks around Mission Control is priceless.

Let's not get into the female kerbals thing again, please.

Ahem...

I'll go now.

Getting back on topic. I was a little unsure about the general idea at first, but it's really grown on me. Some people have been concerned that the barn layout implies that the kerbals are rednecks or incompetent.

It's not like NASA started out with the modern KSC in the first launches. Most of the early funds have to be spent on the state-of-the art rocket parts. When you're starting out--architecture isn't the top priority for a budding agency.

The kerbals on day one aren't incompetent, just broke.
Wait, wait! Did anyone see any outhouses? You know, those little rickety shacks with a crescent mun on the door?

A variable length runway might be interesting. The more it's upgraded, the longer your takeoffs and landings can be, and longer runways are bigger targets for 100% recovery.

That would be a great addition, especially if propellers get added as an early part.

Oh... This looks lovely!

O

I can't wait to learn how this system will work but it's really looking promising!

Can't help but notice the lack of a SPH and runway, though... =P

Early runways were grass airfields (?)

Ok. I've thought about this and looked over the images again, and came to a new conclusion. I still don't like the trailers, but overall it might work out ok.

Though, that leads to my question I haven't seen asked yet. I don't see the ocean in those pics...so where is this tier 1 KSC located?? Is it the same location as current, or somewhere else?

I'll just re-iterate what I said in the other thread:

Not a fan. Completely jars with the visual style found in the rest of the game. The trailers are ok and expected, but the barn, telescope and silos all look too comical. The plane immediately looks out of place next to it all. I'd make the barn smaller and more shed-like, ditch the silos or at least give them better textures, and make the telescope look less steampunk and more like something your typical garden astronomer would put together. Make it look less like Redneck's do space, and more like an amateur astronomy/rocket club if you want a "humble beginnings" theme to the game start.

Ignoring the general style, the models and textures all look a bit rushed and "temporary" although that may be because they aren't yet finished.

Sorry to be so down on it, but it's best to give honest feedback so you guys can improve it and make KSP as great as possible!

I'm not even against the idea of the barn particularly, but it just looks too silly how it is right now. It is like they just took a standard barn model, increased the height and called it a day. To keep it constructive, I'll reference something I came across in the other thread - a building and centre looking more like this would be perfect. The building at the forefront looks like a barn that has been converted to rocket building (not that it necessarily is, but it just looks like it).

If that's the R&D complex, I think that's the early model observatory (modern R&D has an impressive - if ornamental - observatory dome in it, as I recall).

I like this - from such humble beginnings the Kerbals strive for the stars. Feels like KSK's "First Flight" fanfic given form

Yep - I'm very much looking forward to this! Wonder if there are any plans to introduce Tier -1 parts to the game too? Going for the 'first launch' and 'reach 5000m' contracts using an LV15 engine and a couple of RT-5 SRBs would - be largely pointless for most I suspect - but would be the icing on the cake for me.

Oh yes - and how about this for a very kerbal launch control room?

"A two-dimensional world map and two large projector boards dominated the front wall of the flight control room. The map used a series of circles to pinpoint tracking stations. To keep continuous track of the spacecraft, a mini spacecraft model suspended by wires traced its orbit. The projector boards were used to display flight measurements plotted by sliding beads."

Then again, no real space program would work that way right? Right....?

As others have said, I think the biggest issue is the poor quality textures. I think if the textures where better then the whole junk-yard thing would be more palatable.

one thing missing, a farm with cows to send into space :3

oh sorry i meant kows

well, the old fashioned plural form of cow is kine.

I hope that one of the rewards for upgrading the Tracking Station is being able to discover more planets (you start out only seeing Mun and Minmus, then go on to see more planets).

A limited range on the lower tier tracking station would be very cool.

As others have said, I think the biggest issue is the poor quality textures. I think if the textures where better then the whole junk-yard thing would be more palatable.

Cheap and temporary is OK. Ramshackle is okay. But the junkyard (or the trailers looking as if they'd been sitting there since forever) is taking it a step too far, regardless of texture quality.

But as said elsewhere: we'll probably grow out of it in no time, so the precise looks won't matter for long. It will be the first view anyone gets of KSC, though -- so if the textures look cheap, the whole game seems cheap.

I also wonder what reason we will have to upgrade the buildings. For launchpad, hangars and so on it's easy and straighforward. For R&D and tracking station, a reason can be contrived. But why should I ever upgrade administration or the astronaut complex?

I also wonder what reason we will have to upgrade the buildings. For launchpad, hangars and so on it's easy and straighforward. For R&D and tracking station, a reason can be contrived. But why should I ever upgrade administration or the astronaut complex?

So you don't have to look at the textures?

Cheap and temporary is OK. Ramshackle is okay. But the junkyard (or the trailers looking as if they'd been sitting there since forever) is taking it a step too far, regardless of texture quality.

But as said elsewhere: we'll probably grow out of it in no time, so the precise looks won't matter for long. It will be the first view anyone gets of KSC, though -- so if the textures look cheap, the whole game seems cheap.

I also wonder what reason we will have to upgrade the buildings. For launchpad, hangars and so on it's easy and straighforward. For R&D and tracking station, a reason can be contrived. But why should I ever upgrade administration or the astronaut complex?

Ã¢â‚¬Å“The bureaucracy is expanding to meet the needs of the expanding bureaucracy.Ã¢â‚¬Â

- Oscar Wilde

More seriously, the more your space program grows, the more admin is going to be required. Hence an upgraded adminstration building. Similarly for the astronaut complex - the early volunteers (especially the Original Three), flying kerbal-in-a-can missions are probably just fine operating out of a shack. Later on, as the program goes more professional, you're going to need more training facilities and more room for an expanded roster of astronauts.

Edit: Just realised that this missed the point entirely. OK, in game, an updated Admin building could be required to start Strategies and then commit to them beyond a certain level. More speculatively, you might start to get fewer contracts coming your way if your Admin building doesn't look the part. As for the Astronaut complex, , I'm guessing upgrading that tie in with the kerbal experience mechanism that's supposed to be coming.

Edited November 9, 2014 by KSK

I like the RV park. Can I please have a 2 5/16" ball attachment added to the utility parts along with a pigtail for lights and brakes so that I can pull one of the trailers to the Mun? I mean, what better way for Jeb to be stranded in comfort and style than in an 31' travel trailer with double slide outs.

Cheap and temporary is OK. Ramshackle is okay. But the junkyard (or the trailers looking as if they'd been sitting there since forever) is taking it a step too far, regardless of texture quality.

But as said elsewhere: we'll probably grow out of it in no time, so the precise looks won't matter for long. It will be the first view anyone gets of KSC, though -- so if the textures look cheap, the whole game seems cheap.

I also wonder what reason we will have to upgrade the buildings. For launchpad, hangars and so on it's easy and straighforward. For R&D and tracking station, a reason can be contrived. But why should I ever upgrade administration or the astronaut complex?

It would be nice if the capabilities of the facilities grew as you developed your program, not just "popped up" from a derelict junkyard, and just replaced the older models methodically. I'd love it if you had a similar styled VAB for example, but just a heck of a lot smaller so you were forced to think differently about your missions. As you developed, you could pay to expand the building to be larger and therefore support larger rockets and more ambitious projects. I mean, a barn is cool and all, but if it has the same function as the high-tier VAB, i don't really see the point. Why upgrade your facilities if they give you all you need in the first place?

For example, rejig the tech tree so you get tiny parts first. Make them rubbish, but capable. The VAB could start as a converted storage warehouse, small but has the height for the construction of small 3m tall sounding rockets. Get initial science with small SRBs and atmospheric analysis, and build up from there. The launch pad is a flat concrete slab, and the rocket is driven out on the back of a truck-trailer. You watch the launch from a small bunker, and R&D is a little office building overlooking a few large hobbyist telescopes. Linus and Werner share their offices with several bumbling interns, and you see them knocking things over in the background of the info screens. Because the tracking station is little more than a amateur observatory, you can't see the planets properly and orbits are badly approximated. Subtle, reserved stuff like that. I dunno.

That last image is a early control room for ICBMs, for example. Small, clearly insufficiant for a fully fledged space program, but not a barn or rusted cars. With all the references to space history in the game, i don't see how a converted launch silo would do the game any less educational justice. A grain silo doesn't really fit.
Imagine how this would look if the trailers resembled classic '40s Airstreams. That would be so cool.

I think an upgraded launchpad would be good. It could grow more durable with every upgrade.

Also a VAB upgrade would be necessary for taller rockets.
While I am not totally opposed to this style, I think it should be less "rustic" and more "early technology" ... but maybe there are stages in-between that will help bridge this gap.

The art team needs to read this and understand it. It was my dream to work in game art design, until life circumstances made it no longer viable as an option. Modeling is a craft, and it's sad to see so little craftsmanship go into this. I know you guys can do better, and it doesn't help to rush things out if they're going to look like this. This isn't about style, it's about skill.

If the art team isn't quite up to par, then maybe consider paying someone to help them get there. For example, you could pay Porkjet to make a series of internal tutorials. If beta is supposed to come with aesthetic improvements, something absolutely has to be done, if these buildings are any indication.

Sorry to rant, I just love this game too much to see it fall short of its promise.
